domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

RT @Feargal_Sharkey: "Rivers of Shame," today's @thetimes editorial.

Curious as to why @10DowningStreet are putting up with all of this. T…

@ashsmith43 @gow_derek @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV Do the Environment Agency actually ever enforce anything? There is a lot of this sort of thing going on and nothing seems to be done about it. It's not exactly difficult to detect.

@ashsmith43 @EnvAgency @KenGoodwinITV According to last year's data, in 2019 @thameswater spent 2,207 hours, the equivalent of 92 whole days, dumping sewage into the River Coln from the Fairford sewage plant.

"Exceptional circumstance"? https://t.co/trky5H39u8
@Feargal_Sharkey @thetimes @10DowningStreet @EnvAgency Its almost as if they don’t care 🤔

Our best #defence against #flooding is to work with #nature. Many of our #rivers have been straightened & our #floodplains drained to move #water quickly through the #landscape. This water spills out at bottlenecks including our towns & villages. @EnvAgencyMids @HighwaysEngland https://t.co/uI3ZZfG0uJ

How clean are our rivers? 🏞️ Sadly in England, not at all. @EnvAgency data shows every single English river is polluted and only 14% are ecologically healthy 💔

Browse the map below to see local rivers, so this
#FindTheFactsFriday you can #UseYourVoice
